page.title: 02The Mayor of Scunthorpe
page.content: In May we visited the Mayor of Scunthorpe,{Mrs Brenda Kirk.}We walked to the Civic Centre and she showed us round the Mayor's rooms and then talked about her year in office. I asked her if she had ever wished she was not the mayor and she replied that she was often very tired. She liked visiting children in schools, and she fetched handicapped and disabled people to see her in the Civic Centre in her large, black car. She was very proud of Scunthorpe, especially the parks and gardens, but she wished that more jobs for men could be created. Many of our fathers have no jobs because one of the steelworks has closed down. She showed us her robes, trimmed with velvet and mink, and we put them on. The Mayor wears a chain made of gold and enamel round her neck.
